thread.title: Half of Devon wants a second vote on Brexit - and most would vote remain

author: Neil Shaw
title: Half of Devon wants a second vote on Brexit - and most would vote remain
text:
Neil Shaw Head of Digital, live and trending for PlymouthLive, DevonLive and CornwallLive 09:46, 10 DEC 2018 Prime Minister Theresa May makes a statement to MPs in the House of Commons (Image: PA Wire)
Almost 2,000 people from across Devon have had their say on Brexit in a major new snapshot poll - and the county wants a second vote on Brexit.
The survey, carried out on DevonLive, found 47 per cent of people agree that UK voters should be allowed to vote on whether they support the final Brexit deal.
In contrast, 35 per cent say there should not be another public people's vote.
Asked if the referendum were rerun tomorrow how they would vote - 45 per cent said remain and 36 per cent said leave. This is a complete U-turn on the result of the original referendum which saw most of Devon vote leave. Read More UK can revoke Brexit and stay in EU says court
If another referendum were to be held, 44 per cent say it should include an option to stop Brexit, and 40 per cent say it shouldn't.
49 per cent of the 1,821 people who filled in the survey on DevonLive do not want to see a leadership election within the Conservative Party.
And 49 per cent say they are unclear on Labour's policy on Brexit - with just 18 per cent saying they are clear.
It comes as Theresa may prepares to face a vote in Parliament over whether her Brexit plan is acceptable and as the European Court of Justice says the UK can stop the Brexit process without the approval of the EU. Like us on Facebook
